description: '''Dimitrios Yerasimos''' ({{langx|el|Δημήτριος Γεράσιμος}}, {{lang-Latn|el|Dimítrios Yerásimos}}; born 27 October 1963), better known as '''Dimitri from Paris''', is a French [[music producer]], [[disc jockey|DJ]] and composer of [[Greeks|Greek]] descent. His musical influences are rooted in 1970s [[funk]] and [[disco]] sounds that spawned contemporary [[house music]], as well as original soundtracks from 1950s and 1960s movies such as ''[[Breakfast at Tiffany's (film)|Breakfast at Tiffany's]]'', ''[[La Dolce Vita]]'' and ''[[The Party (1968 film)|The Party]]'', which were sampled in his album ''[[Sacrebleu (album)|Sacrebleu]]''. Yerasimos fused these sounds with [[electro music|electro]] and block party [[hip hop music|hip hop]] he discovered in the 1980s.
